page.title: 05PR.HELENA COLLEGE,PRESTON
page.content: Princess Helena College was the first academic school for girls.It was both a day and boarding school and was founded in 1820 to educate daughters of Naval and Military officers who had died in the Napoleonic wars.The girls were admitted at 14 and stayed until they were 21.In 1879 Princess Helena, third daughter of Queen Victoria,be- stowed upon the school its present title.A Royal Charter of Incorporation followed in 1886,the Queen declaring it her will and pleasure that the reigning monarch should ever be its Patron.Princess Helena was associated with the college from 1868 until her death in 1923.In 1935,when the premises in London grew too small, the governors bought Temple Dinsley, an 18th century country house in Preston.
